verses.text: \w After|strong="H0310"\w* these \w things|strong="H1697"\w*, when the \w wrath|strong="H2534"\w* of \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* was \w appeased|strong="H7918"\w*, he \w remembered|strong="H2142"\w* \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w*, and what she had \w done|strong="H6213"\w*, and what was \w decreed|strong="H1504"\w* against her.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w servants|strong="H5288"\w* that \w ministered|strong="H8334"\w* unto him, Let there be \w fair|strong="H2896"\w* \w young|strong="H5291"\w* \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w* \w sought|strong="H1245"\w* for the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*:

And let the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w appoint|strong="H6485"\w* \w officers|strong="H6496"\w* in all the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w* of his \w kingdom|strong="H4438"\w*, that they may gather \w together|strong="H6908"\w* all the \w fair|strong="H2896"\w* \w young|strong="H5291"\w* \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w* unto \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w* the \w palace|strong="H1002"\w*, to the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, unto the \w custody|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Hege|strong="H1896"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w chamberlain|strong="H5631"\w*, \w keeper|strong="H8104"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*; and let their things for \w purification|strong="H8562"\w* be \w given|strong="H5414"\w* \add them:\add*\f + \fr 2.3 \ft unto the…: Heb. unto the hand\f*\f + \fr 2.3 \ft Hege: also called, Hegai\f*

And let the \w maiden|strong="H5291"\w* which \w pleaseth|strong="H3190"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* be \w queen|strong="H4427"\w* instead of \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w*. And the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* \w pleased|strong="H3190"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; and he did \w so|strong="H6213"\w*.

¶ \add Now\add* in \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w* the \w palace|strong="H1002"\w* there was a \w certain|strong="H0376"\w* \w Jew|strong="H3064"\w*, whose \w name|strong="H8034"\w* \add was\add* \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Jair|strong="H2971"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Shimei|strong="H8096"\w*, the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Kish|strong="H7027"\w*, a \w Benjamite|strong="H1145"\w*;

Who had been carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w* from \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w* with the \w captivity|strong="H1473"\w* which had been carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w* with \w Jeconiah|strong="H3204"\w* \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w*, whom \w Nebuchadnezzar|strong="H5019"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* of \w Babylon|strong="H0894"\w* had carried \w away|strong="H1540"\w*.\f + \fr 2.6 \ft Jeconiah: also called, Jehoiachin\f*

And he brought \w up|strong="H0539"\w* \w Hadassah|strong="H1919"\w*, that \add is\add*, \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*, his \w uncle’s|strong="H1730"\w* \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w*: for she had neither \w father|strong="H0001"\w* nor \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*, and the \w maid|strong="H5291"\w* \add was\add* \w fair|strong="H3303"\w* and \w beautiful|strong="H2896"\w*; whom \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, when her \w father|strong="H0001"\w* and \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* were \w dead|strong="H4194"\w*, \w took|strong="H3947"\w* for his own \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w*.\f + \fr 2.7 \ft brought…: Heb. nourished\f*\f + \fr 2.7 \ft fair…: Heb. fair of form, and good of countenance\f*

¶ So it came to pass, when the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w commandment|strong="H1697"\w* and his \w decree|strong="H1881"\w* was \w heard|strong="H8085"\w*, and when \w many|strong="H7227"\w* \w maidens|strong="H5291"\w* were gathered \w together|strong="H6908"\w* unto \w Shushan|strong="H7800"\w* the \w palace|strong="H1002"\w*, to the \w custody|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Hegai|strong="H1896"\w*, that \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* was \w brought|strong="H3947"\w* also unto the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, to the \w custody|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Hegai|strong="H1896"\w*, \w keeper|strong="H8104"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*.

And the \w maiden|strong="H5291"\w* \w pleased|strong="H3190"\w* him, and she \w obtained|strong="H5375"\w* \w kindness|strong="H2617"\w* of \w him|strong="H6440"\w*; and he \w speedily|strong="H0926"\w* \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* her her things for \w purification|strong="H8562"\w*, with such things as \w belonged|strong="H4490"\w* to her, and \w seven|strong="H7651"\w* \w maidens|strong="H5291"\w*, \add which were\add* \w meet|strong="H7200"\w* to be \w given|strong="H5414"\w* her, out of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*: and he \w preferred|strong="H8138"\w* her and her \w maids|strong="H5291"\w* unto the \w best|strong="H2896"\w* \add place\add* of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*.\f + \fr 2.9 \ft such…: Heb. her portions\f*\f + \fr 2.9 \ft preferred: Heb. changed\f*

\w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* had not \w shewed|strong="H5046"\w* her \w people|strong="H5971"\w* nor her \w kindred|strong="H4138"\w*: for \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* had \w charged|strong="H6680"\w* her that she should not \w shew|strong="H5046"\w* \add it\add*.

And \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w walked|strong="H1980"\w* every \w day|strong="H3117"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w court|strong="H2691"\w* of the \w women’s|strong="H0802"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, to \w know|strong="H3045"\w* how \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w did|strong="H7965"\w*, and what should \w become|strong="H6213"\w* of her.\f + \fr 2.11 \ft to know…: Heb. to know the peace\f*

¶ Now when every \w maid’s|strong="H5291"\w* \w turn|strong="H8447"\w* was \w come|strong="H5060"\w* to go \w in|strong="H0935"\w* to \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w*, \w after|strong="H7093"\w* that she had been \w twelve|strong="H8147"\w* \w months|strong="H2320"\w*, according to the \w manner|strong="H1881"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, (for so were the \w days|strong="H3117"\w* of their \w purifications|strong="H4795"\w* \w accomplished|strong="H4390"\w*, \add to wit\add*, \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w months|strong="H2320"\w* with \w oil|strong="H8081"\w* of \w myrrh|strong="H4753"\w*, and \w six|strong="H8337"\w* \w months|strong="H2320"\w* with sweet \w odours|strong="H1314"\w*, and with \add other\add* things for the \w purifying|strong="H8562"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*;)

Then thus \w came|strong="H0935"\w* \add every\add* \w maiden|strong="H5291"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*; whatsoever she \w desired|strong="H0559"\w* was \w given|strong="H5414"\w* her to \w go|strong="H0935"\w* with her out of the \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w* unto the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*.

In the \w evening|strong="H6153"\w* she \w went|strong="H0935"\w*, and on the \w morrow|strong="H1242"\w* she \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* into the \w second|strong="H8145"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, to the \w custody|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Shaashgaz|strong="H8190"\w*, the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w chamberlain|strong="H5631"\w*, which \w kept|strong="H8104"\w* the \w concubines|strong="H6370"\w*: she came \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* no more, except the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w delighted|strong="H2654"\w* in her, and that she were \w called|strong="H7121"\w* by \w name|strong="H8034"\w*.

¶ Now when the \w turn|strong="H8447"\w* of \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w*, the \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Abihail|strong="H0032"\w* the \w uncle|strong="H1730"\w* of \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, who had \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* her for his \w daughter|strong="H1323"\w*, was \w come|strong="H5060"\w* to go \w in|strong="H0935"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, she \w required|strong="H1245"\w* \w nothing|strong="H1697"\w* but what \w Hegai|strong="H1896"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w chamberlain|strong="H5631"\w*, the \w keeper|strong="H8104"\w* of the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, \w appointed|strong="H0559"\w*. And \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w obtained|strong="H5375"\w* \w favour|strong="H2580"\w* in the \w sight|strong="H5869"\w* of all them that \w looked|strong="H7200"\w* upon her.

So \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* was \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* unto \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w* into his \w house|strong="H1004"\w* \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* in the \w tenth|strong="H6224"\w* \w month|strong="H2320"\w*, which \add is\add* the \w month|strong="H2320"\w* \w Tebeth|strong="H2887"\w*, in the \w seventh|strong="H7651"\w* \w year|strong="H8141"\w* of his \w reign|strong="H4438"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w loved|strong="H0157"\w* \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* above all the \w women|strong="H0802"\w*, and she \w obtained|strong="H5375"\w* \w grace|strong="H2580"\w* and \w favour|strong="H2617"\w* in his \w sight|strong="H6440"\w* more than all the \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w*; so that he \w set|strong="H7760"\w* the \w royal|strong="H4438"\w* \w crown|strong="H3804"\w* upon her \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and made her \w queen|strong="H4427"\w* instead of \w Vashti|strong="H2060"\w*.\f + \fr 2.17 \ft favour: or, kindness\f*\f + \fr 2.17 \ft in his…: Heb. before him\f*

Then the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w made|strong="H6213"\w* a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w feast|strong="H4960"\w* unto all his \w princes|strong="H8269"\w* and his \w servants|strong="H5650"\w*, \add even\add* \w Esther’s|strong="H0635"\w* \w feast|strong="H4960"\w*; and he \w made|strong="H6213"\w* a \w release|strong="H2010"\w* to the \w provinces|strong="H4082"\w*, and \w gave|strong="H5414"\w* \w gifts|strong="H4864"\w*, according to the \w state|strong="H3027"\w* of the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.\f + \fr 2.18 \ft release: Heb. rest\f*

And when the \w virgins|strong="H1330"\w* were gathered \w together|strong="H6908"\w* the second \w time|strong="H8145"\w*, then \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*.

\w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* had not \add yet\add* \w shewed|strong="H5046"\w* her \w kindred|strong="H4138"\w* nor her \w people|strong="H5971"\w*; as \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* had \w charged|strong="H6680"\w* her: for \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w did|strong="H6213"\w* the \w commandment|strong="H3982"\w* of \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, like as when she was brought \w up|strong="H0545"\w* with him.

¶ In those \w days|strong="H3117"\w*, while \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w* \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*, \w two|strong="H8147"\w* of the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w chamberlains|strong="H5631"\w*, \w Bigthan|strong="H0904"\w* and \w Teresh|strong="H8657"\w*, of those which \w kept|strong="H8104"\w* the \w door|strong="H5592"\w*, were \w wroth|strong="H7107"\w*, and \w sought|strong="H1245"\w* to \w lay|strong="H7971"\w* \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* on the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w Ahasuerus|strong="H0325"\w*.\f + \fr 2.21 \ft Bigthan: also called, Bigthana\f*\f + \fr 2.21 \ft the door: Heb. the threshold\f*

And the \w thing|strong="H1697"\w* was \w known|strong="H3045"\w* to \w Mordecai|strong="H4782"\w*, who \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \add it\add* unto \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* the \w queen|strong="H4436"\w*; and \w Esther|strong="H0635"\w* \w certified|strong="H0559"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \add thereof\add* in \w Mordecai’s|strong="H4782"\w* \w name|strong="H8034"\w*.

And when \w inquisition|strong="H1245"\w* was made of the \w matter|strong="H1697"\w*, it was found \w out|strong="H4672"\w*; therefore they were \w both|strong="H8147"\w* \w hanged|strong="H8518"\w* on a \w tree|strong="H6086"\w*: and it was \w written|strong="H3789"\w* in the \w book|strong="H5612"\w* of the \w chronicles|strong="H1697"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.
